member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Sidebar.Type
member.summary: Specifies the expanding types of the Sidebar. `Over` - The sidebar floats over the main content area. `Push` - The sidebar pushes the main content area to appear side-by-side, and shrinks the main content within the screen width. `Slide` - The sidebar translates the x and y positions of main content area based on the sidebar width. The main content area will not be adjusted within the screen width. `Auto` - Sidebar with `Over` type in mobile resolution and `Push` type in other higher resolutions. > For more details about SidebarType refer to [`SidebarType`](./variations.html#types) documentation.

member.summary: Sets the CSS classes to root element of the Tab that helps to customize component styles.

member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted. 1. selectedItem

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.EnableRtl
member.summary: Specifies the direction of the Tab. For the culture like Arabic, direction can be switched as right-to-left.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.HeaderPlacement
member.summary: Specifies the orientation of Tab header. The possible values are: - Top: Places the Tab header on the top. - Bottom: Places the Tab header at the bottom.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the Tab component. By default, Tab height is set based on the height of its parent. To use height property, heightAdjustMode must be set to 'None'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.HeightAdjustMode
member.summary: Specifies the height style for Tab content. The possible values are: - None: Based on the given height property, the content panel height is set. - Auto: Tallest panel height of a given Tab content is set to all the other panels. - Content: Based on the corresponding content height, the content panel height is set. - Fill: Based on the parent height, the content panel hight is set.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.Items
member.summary: An array of object that is used to configure the Tab component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.OverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies the Tab display mode when Tab content exceeds the viewing area. The possible modes are: - Scrollable: All the elements are displayed in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled. - Popup: Tab container holds the items that can be placed within the available space and rest of the items are moved to the popup. If the popup content overflows the height of the page, the rest of the elements can be viewed by scrolling the popup.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.SelectedItem
member.summary: Specifies the index for activating the current Tab item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.ShowCloseButton
member.summary: Specifies whether to show the close button for header items to remove the item from the Tab.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Tab component. Default, Tab width sets based on the width of its parent.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.AllowDragAndDrop
member.summary: Indicates whether the TreeView allows drag and drop of nodes. To drag and drop a node in desktop, hold the mouse on the node, drag it to the target node and drop the node by releasing the mouse. For touch devices, drag and drop operation is performed by touch, touch move and touch end. For more information on drag and drop nodes concept, refer to [Drag and Drop](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/treeview/drag-and-drop.html).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.AllowEditing
member.summary: Enables or disables editing of the text in the TreeView node. When `allowEditing` property is set to true, the TreeView allows you to edit the node by double clicking the node or by navigating to the node and pressing F2 key. For more information on node editing, refer to [Node Editing](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/treeview/node-editing.html).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.AllowMultiSelection
member.summary: Enables or disables multi-selection of nodes. To select multiple nodes: Select the nodes by holding down the CTRL key while clicking on the nodes. Select consecutive nodes by clicking the first node to select and hold down the SHIFT key and click the last node to select.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.Animation
member.summary: Specifies the type of animation applied on expanding and collapsing the nodes along with duration.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.CheckedNodes
member.summary: The `checkedNodes` property is used to set the nodes that need to be checked or get the ID of nodes that are currently checked in the TreeView component. The `checkedNodes` property depends upon the value of `showCheckBox` property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS classes to be added with root element of the TreeView to help customize the appearance of the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enables or disables persisting TreeView state between page reloads. If enabled, following APIs will persist. 1. `selectedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are selected in the TreeView component. 2. `checkedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are checked in the TreeView component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enables or disables RTL mode on the component that displays the content in the right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.ExpandOn
member.summary: Specifies the action on which the node expands or collapses. The available actions are, `Auto` - In desktop, the expand/collapse operation happens when you double-click the node, and in mobile devices it happens on single-click. `Click` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you single-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices. `DblClick` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you double-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.Fields
member.summary: Specifies the data source and mapping fields to render TreeView nodes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.FullRowSelect
member.summary: On enabling this property, the entire row of the TreeView node gets selected by clicking a node. When disabled only the corresponding node's text gets selected.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.NodeTemplate
member.summary: Specifies a template to render customized content for all the nodes. If the `nodeTemplate` property is set, the template content overrides the displayed node text. The property accepts template string [template string](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/base/template-engine.html) or HTML element ID holding the content. For more information on template concept, refer to [Template](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/treeview/template.html).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.SelectedNodes
member.summary: Represents the selected nodes in the TreeView component. We can set the nodes that need to be selected or get the ID of the nodes that are currently selected by using this property. On enabling `allowMultiSelection` property we can select multiple nodes and on disabling it we can select only a single node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.ShowCheckBox
member.summary: Indicates that the nodes will display CheckBoxes in the TreeView. The CheckBox will be displayed next to the expand/collapse icon of the node. For more information on CheckBoxes, refer to [CheckBox](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/treeview/checkbox.html).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.SortOrder
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the nodes are sorted in the ascending or descending order, or are not sorted at all. The available types of sort order are, `None` - The nodes are not sorted. `Ascending` - The nodes are sorted in the ascending order. `Descending` - The nodes are sorted in the ascending order.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.AllowDragAndDrop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Indicates whether the TreeView allows drag and drop of nodes. To drag and drop a node in desktop, hold the mouse on the node, drag it to the target node and drop the node by releasing the mouse. For touch devices, drag and drop operation is performed by touch, touch move and touch end. For more information on drag and drop nodes concept, refer to [Drag and Drop](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/treeview/drag-and-drop.html).

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.AllowEditing(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables editing of the text in the TreeView node. When `allowEditing` property is set to true, the TreeView allows you to edit the node by double clicking the node or by navigating to the node and pressing F2 key. For more information on node editing, refer to [Node Editing](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/treeview/node-editing.html).

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.AllowMultiSelection(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables multi-selection of nodes. To select multiple nodes: Select the nodes by holding down the CTRL key while clicking on the nodes. Select consecutive nodes by clicking the first node to select and hold down the SHIFT key and click the last node to select.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.Animation(Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewNodeAnimationSettings)
member.summary: Specifies the type of animation applied on expanding and collapsing the nodes along with duration.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.CheckedNodes(System.String[])
member.summary: The `checkedNodes` property is used to set the nodes that need to be checked or get the ID of nodes that are currently checked in the TreeView component. The `checkedNodes` property depends upon the value of `showCheckBox` property.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.CssClass(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the CSS classes to be added with root element of the TreeView to help customize the appearance of the component.

member.summary: Not applicable to this component.

member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted. 1. value

member.summary: When set to true, enables RTL mode of the component that displays the content in the right-to-left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoComplete.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the component is enabled or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoComplete.Fields
member.summary: The `fields` property maps the columns of the data table and binds the data to the component. text - Maps the text column from data table for each list item value - Maps the value column from data table for each list item iconCss - Maps the icon class column from data table for each list item groupBy - Group the list items with it's related items by mapping groupBy field

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoComplete.FilterBarPlaceholder
member.summary: Not applicable to this component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoComplete.FilterType

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoComplete.FloatLabelType
member.summary: Specifies whether to display the floating label above the input element. Possible values are: Never: The label will never float in the input when the placeholder is available. Always: The floating label will always float above the input. Auto: The floating label will float above the input after focusing or entering a value in the input.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoComplete.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the footer container of the popup list. > For more details about the available template options refer to [`Template`](./templates.html) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoComplete.GroupTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the group headers present in the popup list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoComplete.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the header container of the popup list. > For more details about the available template options refer to [`Template`](./templates.html) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoComplete.Highlight
member.summary: When set to ‘true’, highlight the searched characters on suggested list items. > For more details about the highlight refer to [`Custom highlight search`](./how-to.html#custom-highlight-search) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoComplete.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Allows additional HTML attributes such as title, name, etc., and accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoComplete.IgnoreAccent
member.summary: ignoreAccent set to true, then ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoComplete.IgnoreCase
member.summary: When set to ‘false’, consider the [`case-sensitive`](./filtering.html#case-sensitive-filtering) on performing the search to find suggestions. By default consider the casing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoComplete.Index
member.summary: Not applicable to this component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoComplete.ItemTemplate

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoComplete.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.summary: Specifies a short hint that describes the expected value of the DropDownList component.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoCompleteBuilder.PopupHeight(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the height of the popup list. > For more details about the popup configuration refer to [`Popup Configuration`](./getting-started.html#configure-the-popup-list) documentation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoCompleteBuilder.PopupWidth(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the width of the popup list. By default, the popup width sets based on the width of the component. > For more details about the popup configuration refer to [`Popup Configuration`](./getting-started.html#configure-the-popup-list) documentation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoCompleteBuilder.Query(System.String)
member.summary: Accepts the external [`query`](./api-query.html) that execute along with data processing.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoCompleteBuilder.ShowClearButton(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies whether to show or hide the clear button. When the clear button is clicked, `value`, `text`, and `index` properties are reset to null.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoCompleteBuilder.ShowPopupButton(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to either show or hide the popup button on the component.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoCompleteBuilder.SortOrder(System.Object)
member.summary: Specifies the `sortOrder` to sort the data source. The available type of sort orders are `None` - The data source is not sorting. `Ascending` - The data source is sorting with ascending order. `Descending` - The data source is sorting with descending order.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoCompleteBuilder.SuggestionCount(System.Double)

member.summary: Not applicable to this component.

member.summary: Not applicable to this component.

member.summary: Triggers after data is fetched successfully from the remote server.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.AutoCompleteBuilder.Close(System.String)
member.summary: Triggers when the popup is closed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.ActionFailureTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template and assigns it to the popup list content of the component when the data fetch request from the remote server fails.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.AllowCustom
member.summary: Specifies whether the component allows user defined value which does not exist in data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.AllowFiltering
member.summary: When allowFiltering is set to true, show the filter bar (search box) of the component. The filter action retrieves matched items through the `filtering` event based on the characters typed in the search TextBox. If no match is found, the value of the `noRecordsTemplate` property will be displayed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.Autofill
member.summary: Specifies whether suggest a first matched item in input when searching. No action happens when no matches found.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.CssClass
member.summary: Sets CSS classes to the root element of the component that allows customization of appearance.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.DataSource
member.summary: Accepts the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component. It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of [`DataManager`](./api-dataManager.html).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted. 1. value

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.EnableRtl
member.summary: When set to true, enables RTL mode of the component that displays the content in the right-to-left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the component is enabled or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.Fields
member.summary: The `fields` property maps the columns of the data table and binds the data to the component. text - Maps the text column from data table for each list item. value - Maps the value column from data table for each list item. iconCss - Maps the icon class column from data table for each list item. groupBy - Group the list items with it's related items by mapping groupBy field.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.FilterBarPlaceholder
member.summary: Not applicable to this component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.FloatLabelType
member.summary: Specifies whether to display the floating label above the input element. Possible values are: Never: The label will never float in the input when the placeholder is available. Always: The floating label will always float above the input. Auto: The floating label will float above the input after focusing or entering a value in the input.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the footer container of the popup list. > For more details about the available template options refer to [`Template`](./templates.html) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.GroupTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the group headers present in the popup list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the header container of the popup list. > For more details about the available template options refer to [`Template`](./templates.html) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Allows additional HTML attributes such as title, name, etc., and accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.IgnoreAccent
member.summary: ignoreAccent set to true, then ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.Index
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the selected item in the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownList.ZIndex
member.summary: specifies the z-index value of the component popup element.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.ActionFailureTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: Accepts the template and assigns it to the popup list content of the component when the data fetch request from the remote server fails.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.AllowFiltering(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When allowFiltering is set to true, show the filter bar (search box) of the component. The filter action retrieves matched items through the `filtering` event based on the characters typed in the search TextBox.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.CssClass(System.String)
member.summary: Sets CSS classes to the root element of the component that allows customization of appearance.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.DataSource(System.Object)
member.summary: Accepts the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component. It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of [`DataManager`](./api-dataManager.html).

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.EnablePersistence(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted. 1. value

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.EnableRtl(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When set to true, enables RTL mode of the component that displays the content in the right-to-left direction.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.Enabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the component is enabled or not.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.Fields(Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListFieldSettings)
member.summary: The `fields` property maps the columns of the data table and binds the data to the component. text - Maps the text column from data table for each list item. value - Maps the value column from data table for each list item. iconCss - Maps the icon class column from data table for each list item. groupBy - Group the list items with it's related items by mapping groupBy field.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.FilterBarPlaceholder(System.String)
member.summary: Accepts the value to be displayed as a watermark text on the filter bar.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.FloatLabelType(System.Object)
member.summary: Specifies whether to display the floating label above the input element. Possible values are: Never: The label will never float in the input when the placeholder is available. Always: The floating label will always float above the input. Auto: The floating label will float above the input after focusing or entering a value in the input.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.FooterTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the footer container of the popup list. > For more details about the available template options refer to [`Template`](./templates.html) documentation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.GroupTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the group headers present in the popup list.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.HeaderTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the header container of the popup list. > For more details about the available template options refer to [`Template`](./templates.html) documentation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.HtmlAttributes(System.Object)
member.summary: Allows additional HTML attributes such as title, name, etc., and accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.IgnoreAccent(System.Boolean)
member.summary: ignoreAccent set to true, then ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.Index(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the selected item in the component.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.ItemTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to each list item present in the popup. We have built-in [`template engine`](./template-engine.html)

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.Locale(System.String)
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.NoRecordsTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to popup list of component when no data is available on the component.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.Placeholder(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies a short hint that describes the expected value of the DropDownList component.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.PopupHeight(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the height of the popup list. > For more details about the popup configuration refer to [`Popup Configuration`](./getting-started.html#configure-the-popup-list) documentation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.PopupWidth(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the width of the popup list. By default, the popup width sets based on the width of the component. > For more details about the popup configuration refer to [`Popup Configuration`](./getting-started.html#configure-the-popup-list) documentation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.Query(System.String)
member.summary: Accepts the external [`Query`](./api-query.html) that execute along with data processing.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.ShowClearButton(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies whether to show or hide the clear button. When the clear button is clicked, `value`, `text`, and `index` properties are reset to null.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.SortOrder(System.Object)
member.summary: Specifies the `sortOrder` to sort the data source. The available type of sort orders are `None` - The data source is not sorting. `Ascending` - The data source is sorting with ascending order. `Descending` - The data source is sorting with descending order.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.Text(System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets the display text of the selected item in the component.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.Value(System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the selected item in the component.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.ValueTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the selected list item in the input element of the component. For more details about the available template options refer to [`Template`](./templates.html) documentation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.Width(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the width of the component. By default, the component width sets based on the width of its parent container. You can also set the width in pixel values.

member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Buttons.Button.IconPosition
member.summary: Positions the icon before/after the text content in the Button. The possible values are: Left: The icon will be positioned to the left of the text content. Right: The icon will be positioned to the right of the text content.

member.summary: Allows the appearance of the Button to be enhanced and visually appealing when set to `true`.

member.summary: Makes the Button toggle, when set to `true`. When you click it, the state changes from normal to active.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Popup.ActionOnScroll
member.summary: specifies the action that should happen when scroll the target-parent container. This property should define either `reposition` or `hide`. when set `reposition` to this property, the popup position will refresh when scroll any parent container. when set `hide` to this property, the popup will be closed when scroll any parent container.

member.summary: It is used to denote the target selector where the Tooltip need to be displayed. The target element is considered as parent container.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.TipPointerPosition
member.summary: It is used to set the position of tip pointer on tooltip. When it sets to auto, the tip pointer auto adjusts within the space of target's length and does not point outside. Refer the documentation {@link http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/tooltip/position.html?lang=typescript#tip-pointer-positioning here} to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.Width
member.summary: It is used to set the width of Tooltip component which accepts both string and number values. When set to auto, the Tooltip width gets auto adjusted to display its content within the viewable screen.

member.summary: We can trigger `afterOpen` event after the Tooltip Component gets opened.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.BeforeClose(System.String)
member.summary: We can trigger `beforeClose` event before the Tooltip hides from the screen. If returned false, then the Tooltip is no more hidden.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.BeforeCollision(System.String)
member.summary: We can trigger `beforeCollision` event for every collision fit calculation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.BeforeOpen(System.String)
member.summary: We can trigger `beforeOpen` event before the Tooltip is displayed over the target element. When one of its arguments `cancel` is set to true, the Tooltip display can be prevented. This event is mainly used for the purpose of refreshing the Tooltip positions dynamically or to set customized styles in it and so on.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.BeforeRender(System.String)
member.summary: We can trigger `beforeRender` event before the Tooltip and its contents are added to the DOM. When one of its arguments `cancel` is set to true, the Tooltip can be prevented from rendering on the page. This event is mainly used for the purpose of customizing the Tooltip before it shows up on the screen. For example, to load the AJAX content or to set new animation effects on the Tooltip, this event can be opted. Refer the documentation {@link http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/tooltip/content.html?lang=typescript#dynamic-content-via-ajax here} to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.Created(System.String)
member.summary: We can trigger `created` event after the Tooltip component is created.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.Destroyed(System.String)
member.summary: We can trigger `destroyed` event when the Tooltip component is destroyed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.Aggregates
member.summary: Configures the Grid aggregate rows. > Check the [`Aggregates`](./aggregates.html) for its configuration.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowExcelExport
member.summary: If `allowExcelExport` set to true, then it will allow the user to export grid to Excel file.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowFiltering
member.summary: If `allowFiltering` set to true the filter bar will be displayed. If set to false the filter bar will not be displayed. Filter bar allows the user to filter grid records with required criteria.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowGrouping
member.summary: If `allowGrouping` set to true, then it will allow the user to dynamically group or ungroup columns. Grouping can be done by drag and drop columns from column header to group drop area.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowMultiSorting
member.summary: If `allowMultiSorting` set to true, then it will allow the user to sort multiple column in the grid. > `allowSorting` should be true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowPaging
member.summary: If `allowPaging` is set to true, the pager renders at the footer of the Grid. It is used to handle page navigation in the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowPdfExport
member.summary: If `allowPdfExport` set to true, then it will allow the user to export grid to Pdf file.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowReordering
member.summary: If `allowReordering` is set to true, Grid columns can be reordered. Reordering can be done by drag and drop of a particular column from one index to another index. > If Grid is rendered with stacked headers, reordering is allowed only at the same level as the column headers.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowResizing
member.summary: If `allowResizing` is set to true, Grid columns can be resized.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowRowDragAndDrop
member.summary: If `allowRowDragAndDrop` is set to true, you can drag and drop grid rows at another grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowSelection
member.summary: If `allowSelection` is set to true, it allows selection of (highlight row) Grid records by clicking it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowSorting
member.summary: If `allowSorting` is set to true, it allows sorting of grid records when column header is clicked.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowTextWrap
member.summary: If `allowTextWrap` set to true, then text content will wrap to the next line when its text content exceeds the width of the Column Cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.ChildGrid
member.summary: Defines Grid options to render child Grid. It requires the [`queryString`](./api-grid.html#querystring-string) for parent and child relationship.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.ColumnMenuItems
member.summary:
`columnMenuItems` defines both built-in and custom column menu items.
The available built-in items are, `AutoFitAll` - Auto fit the size of all columns. `AutoFit` - Auto fit the current column. `Group` - Group by current column. `Ungroup` - Ungroup by current column. `SortAscending` - Sort the current column in ascending order. `SortDescending` - Sort the current column in descending order. `Filter` - Filter options will show based on filterSettings property like checkbox filter, excel filter, menu filter.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.Columns
member.summary: Defines the schema of dataSource. If the `columns` declaration is empty or undefined then the `columns` are automatically generated from data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.ContextMenuItems
member.summary:
`contextMenuItems` defines both built-in and custom context menu items.
The available built-in items are, `AutoFitAll` - Auto fit the size of all columns. `AutoFit` - Auto fit the current column. `Group` - Group by current column. `Ungroup` - Ungroup by current column. `Edit` - Edit the current record. `Delete` - Delete the current record. `Save` - Save the edited record. `Cancel` - Cancel the edited state. `Copy` - Copy the selected records. `PdfExport` - Export the grid as Pdf format. `ExcelExport` - Export the grid as Excel format. `CsvExport` - Export the grid as CSV format. `SortAscending` - Sort the current column in ascending order. `SortDescending` - Sort the current column in descending order. `FirstPage` - Go to the first page. `PrevPage` - Go to the previous page. `LastPage` - Go to the last page. `NextPage` - Go to the next page.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.CurrencyCode
member.summary: Defines the currencyCode format of the Grid columns

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.DataSource
member.summary: It is used to render grid table rows. If the `dataSource` is an array of JavaScript objects, then Grid will create instance of [`DataManager`](../data/api-dataManager.html) from this `dataSource`. If the `dataSource` is an existing [`DataManager`](../data/api-dataManager.html), the Grid will not initialize a new one.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.DetailTemplate
member.summary: The detail template allows you to show or hide additional information about a particular row.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.EditSettings
member.summary: Configures the edit settings.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.EnableAltRow
member.summary: If `enableAltRow` is set to true, the grid will render with `e-altrow` CSS class to the alternative tr elements. > Check the [`AltRow`](./row.html#styling-alternate-rows) to customize the styles of alternative rows.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.EnableColumnVirtualization
member.summary: If `enableColumnVirtualization` set to true, then the Grid will render only the columns visible within the view-port and load subsequent columns on horizontal scrolling. This helps to load large dataset of columns in Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.EnableHover
member.summary: If `enableHover` is set to true, the row hover is enabled in the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.EnableVirtualization
member.summary: If `enableVirtualization` set to true, then the Grid will render only the rows visible within the view-port and load subsequent rows on vertical scrolling. This helps to load large dataset in Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.FilterSettings
member.summary: Configures the filter settings of the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.FrozenColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of frozen columns.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.FrozenRows
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of frozen rows.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.GridLines
member.summary: Defines the mode of grid lines. The available modes are, `Both`: Displays both horizontal and vertical grid lines. `None`: No grid lines are displayed. `Horizontal`: Displays the horizontal grid lines only. `Vertical`: Displays the vertical grid lines only. `Default`: Displays grid lines based on the theme.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.GroupSettings
member.summary: Configures the group settings.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.Height
member.summary: Defines the scrollable height of the grid content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.PageSettings
member.summary: Configures the pager in the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.PrintMode
member.summary: Defines the print modes. The available print modes are `AllPages`: Prints all pages of the Grid. `CurrentPage`: Prints the current page of the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.Query

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.QueryString

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.RowTemplate

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.SelectedRowIndex

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.Toolbar
member.summary:
`toolbar` defines the ToolBar items of the Grid. It contains built-in and custom toolbar items. If a string value is assigned to the `toolbar` option, it is considered as the template for the whole Grid ToolBar. If an array value is assigned, it is considered as the list of built-in and custom toolbar items in the Grid's Toolbar.
The following code example implements the custom toolbar items.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridBuilder.EnableAltRow(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If `enableAltRow` is set to true, the grid will render with `e-altrow` CSS class to the alternative tr elements. > Check the [`AltRow`](./row.html#styling-alternate-rows) to customize the styles of alternative rows.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridBuilder.EnableColumnVirtualization(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If `enableColumnVirtualization` set to true, then the Grid will render only the columns visible within the view-port and load subsequent columns on horizontal scrolling. This helps to load large dataset of columns in Grid.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridBuilder.EnableHover(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If `enableHover` is set to true, the row hover is enabled in the Grid.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridBuilder.EnablePersistence(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridBuilder.EnableRtl(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridBuilder.EnableVirtualization(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If `enableVirtualization` set to true, then the Grid will render only the rows visible within the view-port and load subsequent rows on vertical scrolling. This helps to load large dataset in Grid.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridBuilder.GridLines(Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridLine)
member.summary: Defines the mode of grid lines. The available modes are, `Both`: Displays both horizontal and vertical grid lines. `None`: No grid lines are displayed. `Horizontal`: Displays the horizontal grid lines only. `Vertical`: Displays the vertical grid lines only. `Default`: Displays grid lines based on the theme.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridBuilder.Toolbar(System.Object)
member.summary:
`toolbar` defines the ToolBar items of the Grid. It contains built-in and custom toolbar items. If a string value is assigned to the `toolbar` option, it is considered as the template for the whole Grid ToolBar. If an array value is assigned, it is considered as the list of built-in and custom toolbar items in the Grid's Toolbar.
The following code example implements the custom toolbar items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.CustomCharacters
member.summary: Sets the collection of values to be mapped for non-mask elements(literals) which have been set in the mask of MaskedTextBox. In the below example, non-mask elements "P" accepts values "P" , "A" , "p" , "a" and "M" accepts values "M", "m" mentioned in the custom characters collection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Sets a value that enables or disables the persisting state of the MaskedTextBox after reloading the page. If enabled, the 'value' state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.EnableRtl
member.summary: Sets a value that enables or disables the RTL mode on the MaskedTextBox. If it is true, MaskedTextBox will display the content in the right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.Enabled
member.summary: Sets a value that enables or disables the MaskedTextBox component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.FloatLabelType
member.summary: The acts as a label and floats above the MaskedTextBox based on the below values. Possible values are: Never - The floating label will not be enable when the placeholder is available. Always - The floating label always floats above the MaskedTextBox. Auto - The floating label floats above the MaskedTextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.Mask
member.summary: Sets a value that masks the MaskedTextBox to allow/validate the user input. Mask allows as mask elements. If the mask value is empty, the MaskedTextBox will behave as an input element with text type.

member.summary: The acts as a label and floats above the NumericTextBox based on the below values. Possible values are: `Never` - Never floats the label in the NumericTextBox when the placeholder is available. `Always` - The floating label always floats above the NumericTextBox. `Auto` - The floating label floats above the NumericTextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.
